title: Puerto Rico Oversight Board Files New Debt Plan
sub_head: The revised plan eliminates cuts to public-sector retiree benefits, but changes benefits for working teachers and judges
body:
A federal board overseeing Puerto Rico’s bankruptcy this week filed a new plan for restructuring the U.S. territory’s debt that preserves pension benefits for retired public-sector employees, a point of contention that had threatened to derail the debt-restructuring deal.
Hearings on the revised plan are scheduled to start Monday in U.S. Bankruptcy Court in San Juan. Puerto Rico’s debt adjustment would reduce the island’s $33 billion in bonds and other debt to $7 billion in the largest-ever U.S. municipal bankruptcy case.
